semantic_title: Alcohol Use During Pregnancy, Childbirth and Puerperium
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > l. Alcohol, tobacco and drug use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium > 1) Alcohol use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium

content.full_text: Codes under subcategory O99.31, Alcohol use complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be assigned for any pregnancy case when a patient uses alcohol during the pregnancy or postpartum. A secondary code from category F10, Alcohol related disorders, should also be assigned to identify manifestations of the alcohol use. (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding alcohol use in pregnancy requiring dual coding with obstetric and mental health codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)
key_concepts: O99.31 for any alcohol use in pregnancy/postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L53-L54)
F10 secondary code required for manifestations (Evidence: pg no: 68, L54-L56)
Dual coding requirement (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign O99.31 and secondary F10 code for alcohol use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L53-L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any alcohol use during pregnancy or postpartum requires both obstetric complication code and alcohol disorder code (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify alcohol use during pregnancy or postpartum
Step 3: Add secondary F10 code for alcohol manifestations

code_ranges.description: Alcohol use complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 68, L53)
code_ranges.requirement: Primary code for alcohol use in pregnancy
usage_rules: Use for any alcohol use during pregnancy or postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L53-L54)

code_ranges.description: Alcohol related disorders (Evidence: pg no: 68, L55)
usage_rules: Identifies manifestations of alcohol use (Evidence: pg no: 68, L55-L56)

code_categories_mentioned: Subcategory O99.31 - Alcohol use complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 28-year-old female at 24 weeks gestation with alcohol dependence
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify alcohol use complicating pregnancy
Step 3: Add F10.20 for alcohol dependence

correct_coding.sequencing: Obstetric complication first, then alcohol disorder
correct_coding.rationale: Dual coding required for complete documentation of alcohol use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only alcohol disorder code without pregnancy complication code

warnings: Must code any alcohol use during pregnancy or postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L53-L54)
best_practices: Always use dual coding for alcohol use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L52-L56)
common_mistakes: Using only F10 codes without O99.31
tips: Any amount of alcohol use requires coding in pregnancy
implementation_notes: Applies to pregnancy and postpartum periods
clinical_context: Alcohol use is significant complication in pregnancy
